channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AL

item.title: Report E-2023040088
item.description:
Report E-2023040088

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-07T18:10:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-04
  • City: FALKVILLE
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On April 4, 2023, at 1730 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Ranger personnel in Falkville, Alabama regarding the release of approximately 1 quart of Neutrachill (Sodium hydroxide solution, UN1824 8, II). The release was contained to a 1’ x 6’ area of the trailer floor. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. The released product, spent absorbents and all other waste generated were containerized in (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The waste drum was then transported by contractors off site for proper disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Product was being pumped from a tanker trailer to an above ground storage tank. Too much product was pumped into the tank resulting in a spill of approximately 100 gallons of diesel fuel. Driver immediately shit down the delivery. HEPACO environmental cleanup was dispatched to the scene for the cleanup. Approximately 5 cubic yards of oil dry compound was collected along with soil along the edge of the pavement that was impacted. There was no police, fire, or EMS dispatched to the scene

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NMP experienced a release from (3) 50-pound poly bags of UN2680 Lithium Hydroxide Monohydrate. The bags were ripped as a result of improper loading. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3-pounds of product released to a 6' x 3" area of the trailer floor due to being torn against the trailer wall. The three damaged bags and all released product were containerized into 1 30-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023020497
item.description:
Report E-2023020497

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-07T18:10:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-24
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal NBM experienced a release of UN1805 Bonderite C-AK 305 Alkaline Cleaner known as Parco Cleaner 305 from a 55-gallon poly drum due to a forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released to a 30' x 6' area of the concrete dock floor due to a pinhole puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. All impacted absorbents and neutralizer were collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On December 19, 2022 at 1556 ET, XPO Logistics (NBM terminal) contacted ERTS regarding a UN3082, Environmentally hazardous Substance, Liquid, N.O.S. (Diethylmethylbenzenediamine), 9, PG III "OR93SLM" release that was discovered at 1430 ET. It was advised that up to 55 gallons of product released to the trailer floor and lot from at least (1) 55-gallon steel drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment of the material. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately all 55-gallons of product released to an 8' x 10' area of the trailer floor and the asphalt lot below due to a puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon metal drum. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted areas and collected. The impacted absorbents, contaminated pallet, and all other cleanup debris were containerized into six 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO Terminal NBM called in to report a 30-gallon spill of UN1263 "DuraCoat" from a 55-gallon metal drum caused by a forklift puncture and impacting their trailer floor. The spill was ongoing and contained to the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30-gallons of product released to the trailer floor in a 10' x 12' area and to the concrete lot in a 2' x 2' area due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was collected into a 95-gallon poly drum. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted area and then containerized into three 55-gallon poly drums. MEG personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized all paint thinner-impacted material and the damaged pail in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-06T21:08:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-21
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 21, 2022, ERTS was contacted by Landstar regarding the release of approximately 10 gallons of Formaldehyde solution (Formaldehyde Solution, UN2209) from (1) 50-gallon plastic drum. The release was reportedly due to a forklift puncture. ERTS then dispatched contractors to clean up the release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed the cause and amount of the release. Affected media and trailer flooring components were subsequently addressed via absorbents and/or pressure washing activities, while simultaneously collecting rinse-water. Spent absorbents and all other waste material generated were containerized in (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste drums were then transported by contractors to Clean Earth in Glencoe, Alabama for proper disposal.

It was then discovered that the package was leaking on the truck. It was then put in a bag and then a tote and transported to the Hazmat Cage where the Hazmat team was notified of it. DescribePack: The package was inadequately handled and loaded by a package handler and the bucket inside started to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon the discovery that it was leaking the package handler notified the manager who put it in a bag and a tote to have the package not spill its contents anymore

DescribePack: Two of the four paint buckets had their tops popped off and the sides of the buckets were slightly bent. package was possibly dropped. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: driver seemed to have isolated the package in a corner in back of van once they realized it was leaking or as they were about to deliver package back to shipper. Amphomag was spread on dry paint in back of van to try and eliminate fumes.

Captain was notified and FA 1 got the thermal containment bag and water , we put the device in bag and I kept putting water on it . It never flamed up, however even while drowning in water the LED indicator light on the item still lit up. Bag was put in aft lav and monitored by FA2 Hermes. No injuries and bag with unit were left in Birmingham.

  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal NBM reported 50-gallons of UN1992 "B3C Fuel Solutions" released on the trailer floor and underneath the trailer from a 250-gallon plastic tote due to freight falling on top of it. ERTS dispatched HEPACO to conduct all on-site cleanup operations. AT 1746 ET, HEPACO personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to the entire trailer floor and a 20' x 5' area of the yard underneath the trailer. The contractors transferred the remaining product into a new tote to be sent to the shipper. Absorbents were worked into the impacted areas and collected into a (2) 55-gallon metal drums along with the cut up tote. All waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

DescribePack: The cap was loose and the contents leaked out DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: After it was found that the box was wet and possibly leaking something, the box and its contents were put into a tote to help the contents to not to release on the floor anymore
